snippet: The new Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space tells the history of the riots, demonstrations, squats and community gardens in the East Village.
abstract: Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space, founded by Bill DiPaola and Laurie Mittelmann on Avenue C in Manhattan, tells story of radical history of East Village, from 1988 riots in Tompkins Square Park to formation of squats and standoffs over community gardens.
lead_paragraph: The new Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space tells the history of the riots, demonstrations, squats and community gardens in the East Village.

headline.seo: The Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space Enshrines the East Village Struggle
headline.main: East Village Shrine to Riots and Radicals
headline.print_headline: East Village Shrine to Riots and Radicals
